whatIsElixirUI.title: What is Elixir UI?
whatIsElixirUI.description: Elixir UI is a modern React component library designed to empower developers to build beautiful, responsive, and accessible user interfaces with speed and efficiency. It is a super set of components for React, built with CSS modules. Elixir UI is designed to be a flexible and extensible toolkit that can be used to build a wide variety of user interfaces. It is designed to be easy to use, easy to customize, and easy to extend. Elixir UI is designed to be a flexible and extensible toolkit that can be used to build a wide variety of user interfaces. nextJS.heading: Next.js
nextJS.description: Next.js is the most popular React framework. It is a great choice for building static and server-rendered applications. If you are using Next.js, you can follow the steps below to use Elixir UI in your application.

steps.addLayers: Add the layers for the Elixir UI variables and components in your globals.css file. Also, add another layer for your global styles (recommended).
steps.whenUsingLayers: When using CSS layers the first layer is the one that has the lower priority. The layer for the Elixir UI variables must be added before the layer for the components.
steps.addTheCSSImport: Add the CSS import in your layout.(jsx|tsx) file. Be sure to add this import before the import of the components.

vite.description: Vite is a build tool that aims to provide a faster and more efficient development experience for modern web projects. If you are using Vite, you can follow the steps below to use Elixir UI in your application.

steps.addLayers: Add the layers for the Elixir UI variables and components in your index.css file. Also, add another layer for your global styles (recommended).

steps.addTheCSSImport: Add the CSS import in your main.(jsx|tsx) file. Be sure to add this import before the import of the components.

description.tailwindIs: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides low-level utility classes to build designs directly in your markup.
description.allElixirUIComponents: All Elixir UI components allow you to add custom classes to the component, which will override the default styles. In this way, Elixir UI is fully compatible with Tailwind CSS.
description.ifYouAreUsingTailwindCSS: If you are using Tailwind CSS, you can follow the steps below to use Elixir UI in your application.

steps.wrapDirectives: Wrap the tailwind directives with the @layer directive in your CSS file. You must create a layer for the base styles and another one for the utilities.
steps.addLayers: Add the layers for the Elixir UI variables and components in your tailwind.css file. Also, add another layer for your global styles (recommended).
steps.whenUsingLayers: When using CSS layers the first layer is the one that has the lower priority. The layer for the Elixir UI variables must be added before the layer for the components.
